pages.title: Overview
pages.text: Filtering in pedestals may seem a bit odd at first, but it can be very useful, and filters are only limited by the size of the inventory containers you have available`. $(li)Filters can also be used in conjunction with upgrades, for a variety of effects. (Please see the specific upgrades for those effects)

pages.title: Interactions
pages.text: $(li)$(l)CROUCH RIGHT CLICK$() an inventory to $(l)SET$() the filter. $(li)$(l)CROUCH RIGHT CLICK$() in the $(l)AIR$() to change the filter between WhiteList and Blacklist (if applicable). $(li)With a $(l:pedestals:tools/filtertool)Filter Tool$() in the $(l)OFFHAND$() and Filter in the $(l)MAINHAND, CROUCH RIGHT CLICK$() in the $(l)AIR$() to $(l)RESET$() the Filter.

pages.title: Interactions Cont.
pages.text: $(li)With a Filter in the $(l)OFFHAND, RIGHTCLICK$() with an $(l)EMPTY MAINHAND$() to insert it into a pedestal. $(li)With a $(l:pedestals:tools/filtertool)Filter Tool$() in the $(l)OFFHAND, LEFT CLICK$() a pedestal to remove its inserted filter.
